content: On June 28, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated a remarkable milestone as they achieved their 50th victory of the season, defeating the Cincinnati Reds 4-2. This win was a testament to the Bravesâ€™ strong pitching staff, led by Greg Maddux, who would go on to win the Cy Young Award that year. The victory solidified the Braves as a dominant force in the National League, ultimately leading them to a World Series championship later that fall.
